newsitem.title: INDIA: Gates urges Indian programmers to think global.
newsitem.headline: Gates urges Indian programmers to think global.

text.p: Microsoft Corp chairman Bill Gates said on Wednesday that infrastructure improvements were crucial to India's plans to emerge as a software superpower in the next century.
Gates told a meeting of the heads of 500 Indian software firms in Bombay, India's commercial capital, that he wanted to exploit their employees' skills.
"India has what it takes to participate in, even to shape, the future if it makes the necessary investments now," he said.
"It must build a national telecommunications infrastructure, develop a robust domestic software industry, provide Internet connectivity for the consumer and invest in education."
Thousands of Indian software engineers see Gates as a success story to emulate in a high-growth industry.
India's software industry, which reported sales worth $1.2 billion in 1995/96 (April-March), expects to grow by 50 percent to $1.8 billion in the 1996/97 fiscal year that ends this month.
The Microsoft chief, who arrived in New Delhi on Monday at the start of a four-day visit, has had meetings with Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda and Finance Minister P. Chidambaram.
"India has just one computer per thousand people today," Gates said. "It is worthwhile to make the education investment and effort to pull more of the people into computers."
Gates, who owns 25 percent of Microsoft, said the company was committed to establishing India as a global pool of talent and resources in computer software.
"The investment we're going to make here is going to continue to grow and grow," he said.

He chalked out a strategy for Indian software firms, advising them to graduate from doing essentially project-based development to selling their own packaged products, and to develop applications for local markets to meet local needs.

Gates urged the software chiefs to invest in research and development -- an area in which his own firm plans to invest $2 billion this year -- as well as make use of the Internet to market their products globally.
